org.sd.cio
Class FilenameGenerator

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.cio.FilenameGenerator

public class FilenameGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

Utility to use a NameGenerator to create successive file (or dir) names.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

FilenameGenerator

public FilenameGenerator(java.io.File dir,
                         NameGenerator nameGenerator,
                         int maxCount)
Construct with the given params.

Parameters:
dir - The directory in which the filenames are being generated.
nameGenerator - The name generator to use.
maxCount - The maximum number of filenames to generate in the dir.
Method Detail

listFiles

public final java.io.File[] listFiles()
Get all existing files matching the name generator (sorted).

getLastFile

public final java.io.File getLastFile()
Get the last file matching the name generator.

getNextLocalName

public final java.lang.String getNextLocalName(FilenameGenerator.CreateFlag createFlag)
Generate the next available local name.

Parameters:
createFlag - if null or NONE, do nothing; if FILE, then create an empty file to reserve the name; if DIR, then create an empty dir to reserve the name.
Returns:
the local name part such that new File(dir, result) references the new file; or null if no more files will fit in the directory.
